DataElement.preferredName: RT Beam High Dose Treatment Type

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Beam High Dose Technique Type
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles._An elevated level or position or degree; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: CS: A string of characters with leading or trailing spaces being non-significant consisting of Upper Case, 0-9, SPACE, Underscore. [Standard-based]_An elevated level or position or degree; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions._A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

(NCI)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy to the entire body. Usually followed by bone marrow or peripheral stem cell transplantation.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the irradiation of the whole body with ionizing or non-ionizing radiation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Regularly and widely used.: A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.

Concepts.definition: A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DICOM Condition
ReferenceDocuments.description: Required if treatment technique requires a dose that would normally require overriding of treatment machine safety controls.
